main event: On May 2nd, 1949 in Elko, Nevada, a Civil Aeronautics Administration Radio Operator observed three unidentified circular objects flying in an inverted vee formation.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be around 30 feet in diameter and made of metal with the appearance of oxidized aluminum.
The objects were seen at an altitude of 14,000 feet and traveling at a speed of 250-300 miles per hour.
No sound, engine exhaust, projections, or lights were observed on the objects.
The objects were within the witness's vision for about two minutes before disappearing after tilting and veering left.
The witness was considered reliable and had an above-average intelligence, with no derogatory information found in his files.
sighted object: three unidentified circular objects in inverted vee formation
